title: Strengthening Learning Design Competencies: Technology-Enhanced Social Education Course Design for Gen Z Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of social sciences and proficiency in digital device utilization
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Propose at least three technology-enhanced instructional designs reflecting Z-generation learners’ digital native characteristics

Trainees will design a 2-week lesson module incorporating three or more asynchronous interactive activities (discussions, quizzes, feedback) using LMS (Google Classroom, Moodle) and smartphone-compatible tools (Kahoot!, Padlet), achieving over 80% suitability in peer reviews and expert evaluations
Recontextualize advanced social studies concepts into Z-generation-friendly media formats (infographics, short videos, etc.)

Within 4 weeks, learners will design an assessment system (3 quiz types, 1 portfolio) applicable in offline/low-spec digital environments (using only basic smartphone functions) and submit a prototype document meeting at least four of five institutional checklist items

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
